{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Curve of Spee is defined as the curvature of the mandibular occlusal plane beginning at the canine and following the buccal cusps of the posterior teeth, continuing to the terminal molar. This is mentioned in Document [0]. The Wilson curve is the across arch curvature or posterior occlusal plane, which is not the same as the curve passing through the buccal and lingual cusp tips of the mandibular buccal teeth. This is mentioned in Document [3]. The Mansoon curve and Catenary curve are not mentioned in the documents, so they can be ruled out.", "answer_choice": "C"}
